post:
How was your experience with the second shot if you had covid and a bad reaction to the first?
Obviously everyone is different but apparently if you had covid the first shot could be bad which is was for me. I had a fever and aches and pains for 2 nights. First night it was pretty hot My bedroom but I was shivering. Second night I woke up drenched in sweat. all while feeling achy and exhausted. Thankfully that next morning I woke up pretty much fine.  Pretty much exactly how I felt with covid but thankfully a shorter timeframe. 

IÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€Ã‚Â™m really just wondering how people in similar situations reacted to the second shot? I need to mentally prepare myself for it if itÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€Ã‚Â™s basically the same. IÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€Ã‚Â™ll definitely be taking off work too. Or could we only be so lucky that the reaction ends up not being as bad.
reasoning: The poster is sharing their experience with side effects after the first vaccine shot, especially after having had COVID previously, and is asking others about their experiences with the second shot to mentally prepare. They mention the side effects were similar to having COVID but shorter in duration, and express willingness to take time off work for the second shot. There is no indication of discouraging vaccination or expressing regret; rather, the post is focused on managing expectations and preparation. The intention is not to discourage vaccination but to seek information and support.

post:
Eye Floaters after Pfizer COVID vaccine
Has anyone else noticed an increase in eye floaters and hazy vision after the Pfizer COVID vaccine? Other than seasonal eye allergies, I do not have issues with my eyes. About a month after my 2nd vaccine, my eye started burning, watering excessively, redness and dryness, floaters, and hazy white areas. The symptoms transitioned to my other eye. IÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€Ã‚Â™ve seen my eye doctor 3 times and everything appears to be great (he did a macular scan to check the overall eye health). Oddly, I found this article which seems to mail what IÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€Ã‚Â™ve been experiencing. I wanted to ask if anyone else is experiencing something similar. 

https://m.jpost.com/health-science/pfizer-covid-19-vaccine-linked-to-rare-cases-of-eye-inflammation-study-675839/amp
reasoning: The post describes the user's experience of developing eye floaters and other eye symptoms after receiving the Pfizer COVID vaccine. The user mentions that their eye doctor found no issues and that they are seeking to compare experiences with others, referencing an article about rare cases of eye inflammation post-vaccination. The post does not discourage vaccination or express regret about being vaccinated; it is focused on sharing a personal experience and seeking information. There is no clear support or opposition to vaccination, and the intention is not to dissuade others from getting vaccinated.

Why is Canada not giving COVID booster shots to pregnant women?
This is a bit of a rant more than anything. I’m in Ontario and am double vaxxed with Pfizer. My second shot was at 6 weeks pregnant in July meaning 6 months after my shot is basically Christmas. I am currently 21 weeks pregnant and due early March. It seems like every other high risk group is getting a booster shot except pregnant women. In the US, pregnant women can get booster shots. I desperately want to get one closer to my due date so my baby can have some protection from antibodies. I really hope they start offering it soon…Is there someone we can lobby for this?

CMV: Any person who willingly declines to get vaccinated for COVID should be denied medical treatment if they are ultimately infected.
Preface: this does not apply to those who cannot be vaccinated due to pre-existing conditions or other health reasons.

The pandemic is continuing only because of people who are refusing to trust vaccines en masse. These people make up nearly all hospitalizations and COVID-related illnesses. Furthermore, I'd posit that the more likely you are to decline the vaccine, the likelier you are to engage in riskier behaviors such as avoid mask-wearing.

The end result is that our healthcare system is being overrun again and it was COMPLETELY avoidable. As a result, those who may need medical care may be denied because there simply aren't enough resources.

Imagine that we are all in a flood and the waters are rising. We are all stranded on our roofs and emergency services are thinned out. Some idiots decide "the flood isn't real" and voluntarily jump into the water and start to drown, pleading for help. Rescuers respond, but other people die too.  Why rescue those so willing to put everyone else at risk?

These people are either selfish, or idiots. They don't deserve medical care.

60% of police officers refusing vaccine
I am close to a police officer in a major US city. City government recently announced that the jab is mandatory for all city employees, including police officers. The police union surveyed its members, and here's how the officers responded:

"If your employer were to mandate the COVID-19 vaccine as a condition of employment, would you get vaccinated?"  73%  no, 27% yes.

"Have you received the COVID-19 vaccine?" 60% no, 40% yes.

DO NOT GIVE IN!

I wanted to know if anyone else had the same issue? I think I read one comment somewhere in this sub about how someoneÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€Ã‚Â™s was triggered after they got Covid.

Never seen anything like this vaccine extremism
I don't ask anyone if they have taken the vaccine. I would never dream of prying into someone's medical history unannounced. This is akin to walking up to someone and asking if they've had a vasectomy or any surgeries. If they haven't, great, it's somebody I know I can have a beer with. If they have, also great, it's also somebody I could have a beer with. Maybe there's just one topic we shouldn't talk about, no big deal.

But not them. I just joined a subreddit dedicated to a TV show. There was a person on the show who had been prescribed gabapentin for depression. Gabapentin is not an anti depressant and ironically causes suicidal thoughts - this is written in bold on the drug. So I said some doctors were dumb. Coming from me, having been disabled by a doctor's malpractice at 31, this is a very reasonable thing to say.

And then within an hour somebody had clicked on my name, went through my post history, and replied not about the TV show but with "anti vaxxer" accusations. These people have taken the fun out of life. We had a TV show we liked in common, but he just had to pry. When I clicked on his profile his avatar is a dude with a pink goatee, so I'm not entirely surprised.

My family is fighting daily amongst each other with the family medical professional pushing everyone else on how "safe and effective" it is and somebody else mulling over the decision every second of every day. This person keeps reminding me all the reasons they don't want to take it until I've finally said several times "then don't take it, but shut the hell up about it already"

What is this all about? Is it just really nosy people who want to impose compliance? Or is it all an attempt to humblebragging what a hero they are because by virtue of their insults, they're announcing they are vaccinated?

Mixing Covid vaccines from Sinovac and Pfizer - what could go wrong?
Title, but let me provide a little context.

I (25M) got a shot of Sinovac's CoronaVac in the Philippines 25 days ago as of writing. I'm due for a 2nd dose in 3 days, but the problem is I am currently in the US for the next 25 days and they only have Pfizer / Moderna vaccines here, no Sinovac CoronaVac anywhere. So I am going to miss / be late for my 2nd Sinovac dose.

Due to some personal circumstances, I am considering to get fully-vaxxed with Pfizer / Moderna within the 25-day period I am here in the US, instead of taking the late 2nd dose of Sinovac upon return to the Philippines.

However, I was told at a CVS near me that Sinovac and Pfizer / Moderna must not be taken together within 60 days of each other. As there isn't enough statistics on mixing vaccines, I figured that this 60-day thing is just a precautionary protocol without solid basis. I wonder what kind of risk I'm taking if I was to insist on taking 1st dose of Pfizer today then 2nd dose 21 days later, considering I've just been injected with Sinovac 25 days ago.

I would appreciate some expert opinion and insight.

TLDR: I have to be fully-vaxxed by November 20. I can make it if I take Pfizer today, except I took 1st of 2 doses of Sinovac 24 days ago and was told to wait 36 more days before taking Pfizer.

Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine + POTS
Hi, I received my first dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine yesterday. I thought that it may be helpful to share what my side effects were. 

Within about 30 minutes of receiving it, my arm was starting to feel a little bit weaker and tingly and I started developing a headache.
Within the next few hours the headache and arm soreness progressed, with the arm only getting to just a little sore and weak feeling. Not as bad as a tough workout. I was up and moving around at my job and I started getting pretty POTS-y. My heart rate was at >=120 BPM and my balance and eyesight were both shaky. I made it back to my desk and drank a good amount of water including a nuun tablet over the course of the next hour and my body stabilized enough to feel okay. The rest of the day, I just made sure to be extra careful with my water intake and activity.

Overnight, I slept poorly and my arm advanced to feeling like I had done a tough workout and also had a big bruise on the injection site. My headache has persisted, but is manageable with Tylenol.



I hope that this information is helpful to anybody. Personally, I'd advise making sure that you have some good hydration options available for after the shot, and be prepared to take it easy day of.

I've included my bio/health stats below just in case anybody is curious or wants to see how similar their symptoms may be.

26F

POTS

EDS-hypermobile type

Fibromyalgia

Psoriasis

Psoriatic arthritis

Celiac disease

Scoliosis

ANA-positive

-
-
-

*2nd Dose Update *

Okay, first 10-12 hours after getting the shot, I felt fine. My arm was only barely sore during this time. After that, it got rough.
I tossed and turned all night with crazy fever dreams and was in a lot of pain all over. I also had a massive pounding headache. 

In the morning I took my temperature and had a fever of 100.5 F. I usually run around 97.5 F, and very very rarely get fevers over 99.5, so this was distinct for me. I called into work for the day and have mostly been sleeping and occasionally taking Tylenol. My heart rate has been consistently over 120 bpm. 

It's now been about 26 hours since receiving my 2nd dose and I'm feeling a bit better from this morning, but I still feel quite awful and feel unsteady when I stand up.



Much love and luck to you all. ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚ÂÃ‚Â¤ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¸Ã‚Â
